page.title: 02Landscape of the Block
page.content: The 4 X 3km block does not encompass the whole of Much Hadham but runs North of the Primary school, along the drive of Moor Place (dated 1775) to Hadham Ford south of Little Hadham. It encompasses the hamlets of Wellpond Green and Westland Green. It is predominantly an agricultural area of intensive farming, mainly arable, with high return cash crops. The land cover is open fields, meadows and woodlands, with many desirable residences dotted about. About 150 years ago, because of easy access to London, Much Hadham became very popular as a weekend retreat for the wealthy London merchants. They came and built fine houses in and around the village.
